item.title: Critical Langflow Vulnerability (CVE-2025-3248) Actively Exploited to Deliver Flodrix Botnet
item.description: This blog uncovers an active campaign exploiting CVE-2025-3248 in Langflow versions before 1.3.0 that deploys the Flodrix botnet, enabling threat actors to achieve full system compromise, initiate DDoS attacks, and potentially exfiltrate sensitive data.
item.dc:creator: Aliakbar Zahravi
Ahmed Mohamed Ibrahim
Sunil Bharti
Shubham Singh
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Clone, Compile, Compromise: Water Curse’s Open-Source Malware Trap on GitHub
item.description: The Trend Micro™ Managed Detection and Response team uncovered a threat campaign orchestrated by an active group, Water Curse. The threat actor exploits GitHub, one of the most trusted platforms for open-source software, as a delivery channel for weaponized repositories.
item.dc:creator: Jovit Samaniego
Aira Marcelo
Mohamed Fahmy
Gabriel Nicoleta
item.category: Trend Micro Research : APT & Targeted Attacks
Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Anubis: A Closer Look at an Emerging Ransomware with Built-in Wiper
item.description: Anubis is an emerging ransomware-as-a-service (RaaS) group that adds a destructive edge to the typical double-extortion model with its file-wiping feature. We explore its origins and examine the tactics behind its dual-threat approach.
item.dc:creator: Maristel Policarpio
Sarah Pearl Camiling
Sophia Nilette Robles
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Critical SAP Vulnerability Exposes Enterprises
item.description: CVE-2025-31324 in SAP NetWeaver Visual Composer enables unauthenticated file uploads, exposing systems to RCE and data loss - learn what to do about it.
item.dc:creator: Dereus Caldwell
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Innovation in the Fast Lane: Lessons from Motorsport and Cybersecurity
item.description: Learn how Trend Micro and NEOM McLaren Formula E Team turn creativity into innovation by rethinking team structures, workflows, and data use.
item.dc:creator: Marianne Lee

item.title: Enabling Secure AI Inference: Trend Cybertron Leverages NVIDIA Universal LLM NIM Microservices
item.description: Learn how Trend's Cybertron has been harnessing the power of NVIDIA Universal LLM NIM Microservices.
item.dc:creator: Patrick Lu
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Operation Secure: Trend Micro's Threat Intelligence Fuels INTERPOL's Infostealer Infrastructure Takedown
item.description: In this blog, we discuss how Trend Micro played a pivotal role in Operation Secure, a multi-national law enforcement effort that dismantled the infrastructure behind widespread infostealer malware campaigns across Asia and the Pacific.
item.dc:creator: Joshua Paul Ignacio
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Keeping Pace and Embracing Emerging Technologies
item.description: Trend Micro and the NEOM McLaren Formula E Team stay ahead of the curve by embracing new technologies, fostering a no-blame culture, and making split-second decisions in high-stakes environments.
item.dc:creator: Robert McArdle

item.title: NEOM McLaren Formula E Team & Trend Micro Innovation History
item.description: Explore how innovation becomes a team sport when Trend Micro and the NEOM McLaren Formula E Team leaders come together to talk culture, risk, and forward thinking.
item.dc:creator: Greg Young

item.title: Stay Ahead of Cyber Threats Sweeping Container Telemetry data
item.description: Threat Intelligence Sweeping starts to support sweep container security telemetry data. It helps identify possible attacks happened based on TI intelligence in container environment. The trigger events are visible in workbench alert.

trendmicro:author.title: Director, PM & PMM - Trend Vision One Cloud Security

item.title: How Google’s Wiz Acquisition Impacts CNAPP
item.description: Google aims to stake out a share of the CNAPP market and compete head-on against AWS and Microsoft Azure with its planned Wiz acquisition. What are the implications for companies invested in AWS and Azure cloud infrastructure?

item.title: Driving Success on the Track or in the Boardroom
item.description: Discover how the Trend Micro and the NEOM McLaren Formula E Team partnership is powered by a common vision for winning, on the track and in the boardroom.

item.title: Trend Micro Leading the Fight to Secure AI

item.title: Earth Lamia Develops Custom Arsenal to Target Multiple Industries
item.description: Trend™ Research has been tracking an active APT threat actor named Earth Lamia, targeting multiple industries in Brazil, India and Southeast Asia countries at least since 2023. The threat actor primarily exploits vulnerabilities in web applications to gain access to targeted organizations.
item.dc:creator: Joseph C Chen
item.category: Trend Micro Research : APT & Targeted Attacks
Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Fake CAPTCHA Attacks Deploy Infostealers and RATs in a Multistage Payload Chain
item.description: We have detected a new tactic involving fake CAPTCHA pages that trick users into executing harmful commands in Windows. This scheme uses disguised files sent via phishing and other malicious methods.

Khristoffer Jocson
Maylein Tom
Lisa Wu
Ariel Renix
Mohamed Fahmy
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Using Agentic AI & Digital Twin for Cyber Resilience
item.description: Learn how Trend is combining agentic AI and digital twin to transform the way organizations protect themselves from cyber threats.
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Trend Secures AI Infrastructure with NVIDIA
item.description: Together, we are focused on securing the full AI lifecycle—from development and training to deployment and inference—across cloud, data center, and AI factories.
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Trend Micro Puts a Spotlight on AI at Pwn2Own Berlin
item.description: Get a sneak peak into how Trend Micro's Pwn2Own Berlin 2025 is breaking new ground, focusing on AI infrastructure and finding the bugs to proactively safeguard the future of computing.
item.dc:creator: Russ Meyers
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Earth Ammit Disrupts Drone Supply Chains Through Coordinated Multi-Wave Attacks in Taiwan
item.description: Trend™ Research discusses the evolving tradecraft of threat actor Earth Ammit, proven by the advanced toolset used in its TIDRONE and VENOM campaigns that targeted the drone supply chain.
item.dc:creator: Pierre Lee
Vickie Su
Philip Chen
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Maritime Cybersecurity: Threats & Regulations Loom
item.description: This review summarizes the key insights shared during the webinar held on April 9th, which featured maritime cybersecurity experts discussing the growing challenges facing ports, logistics operations, and global supply chains.

trendmicro:author.name: Zack Martin
trendmicro:author.title: Senior Policy Advisor, Cybersecurity Services, Venable LLP

item.dc:creator: Zack Martin
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Agenda Ransomware Group Adds SmokeLoader and NETXLOADER to Their Arsenal
item.description: During our monitoring of Agenda ransomware activities, we uncovered campaigns that made use of the SmokeLoader malware and a new loader we've named NETXLOADER.
item.dc:creator: Jacob Santos
Raymart Yambot
John Rainier Navato
Sarah Pearl Camiling
Neljorn Nathaniel Aguas
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Exploring PLeak: An Algorithmic Method for System Prompt Leakage
item.description: What is PLeak, and what are the risks associated with it? We explored this algorithmic technique and how it can be used to jailbreak LLMs, which could be leveraged by threat actors to manipulate systems and steal sensitive data.
item.dc:creator: Karanjot Singh Saggu
Anurag Das
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Earth Kasha Updates TTPs in Latest Campaign Targeting Taiwan and Japan
item.description: This blog discusses the latest modifications observed in Earth Kasha’s TTPs from their latest campaign detected in March 2025 targeting Taiwan and Japan.
item.dc:creator: Hara Hiroaki
item.category: Trend Micro Research : APT & Targeted Attacks
Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: NVIDIA Riva Vulnerabilities Leave AI-Powered Speech and Translation Services at Risk
item.description: Trend Research uncovered misconfigurations in NVIDIA Riva deployments, with two vulnerabilities, CVE-2025-23242 and CVE-2025-23243, contributing to their exposure. These security flaws could lead to unauthorized access, resource abuse, and potential misuse or theft of AI-powered inference services, including speech recognition and text-to-speech processing.
item.dc:creator: Alfredo Oliveira
David Fiser
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Earth Kurma APT Campaign Targets Southeast Asian Government, Telecom Sectors
item.description: An APT group dubbed Earth Kurma is actively targeting government and telecommunications organizations in Southeast Asia using advanced malware, rootkits, and trusted cloud services to conduct cyberespionage.
item.dc:creator: Nick Dai
Sunny Lu
item.category: Trend Micro Research : APT & Targeted Attacks
Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Russian Infrastructure Plays Crucial Role in North Korean Cybercrime Operations
item.description: In this blog entry, we discuss how North Korea's significant role in cybercrime – including campaigns attributed to Void Dokkaebi – is facilitated by extensive use of anonymization networks and the use of Russian IP ranges.
item.dc:creator: Feike Hacquebord
Stephen Hilt
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: FOG Ransomware Spread by Cybercriminals Claiming Ties to DOGE
item.description: This blog details our investigation of malware samples that conceal within them a FOG ransomware payload.
item.dc:creator: Nathaniel Morales
Sarah Pearl Camiling
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: CrazyHunter Campaign Targets Taiwanese Critical Sectors
item.description: This blog entry details research on emerging ransomware group CrazyHunter, which has launched a sophisticated campaign aimed at Taiwan's essential services.
item.dc:creator: Maristel Policarpio
Sarah Pearl Camiling
Jacob Santos
Cj Arsley Mateo
Ieriz Nicolle Gonzalez
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Strengthen Security with Cyber Risk Advisory
item.description: In today’s fast-paced digital world, cyber threats are constantly evolving. Attackers are leveraging advanced techniques and artificial intelligence (AI) to exploit vulnerabilities, leaving organizations vulnerable to breaches and disruptions. To combat these challenges, organizations must stay vigilant and implement more proactive cybersecurity measures. This is where our Cyber Risk Advisory service, powered by the Trend Vision One™ Cyber Risk Exposure Management (CREM) solution, step in to provide a strategic edge.
item.dc:creator: Kim Kinahan
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Top 10 for LLM & Gen AI Project Ranked by OWASP
item.description: Trend Micro has become a Gold sponsor of the OWASP Top 10 for LLM and Gen AI Project, merging cybersecurity expertise with OWASP's collaborative efforts to address emerging AI security risks. This partnership underscores Trend Micro's unwavering commitment to advancing AI security, ensuring a secure foundation for the transformative power of AI.
item.dc:creator: Kim Kinahan
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: ZDI-23-1527 and ZDI-23-1528: The Potential Impact of Overly Permissive SAS Tokens on PC Manager Supply Chains
item.description: In ZDI-23-1527 and ZDI-23-1528 we uncover two possible scenarios where attackers could have compromised the Microsoft PC Manager supply chain.
item.dc:creator: Nitesh Surana
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: BPFDoor’s Hidden Controller Used Against Asia, Middle East Targets
item.description: A controller linked to BPF backdoor can open a reverse shell, enabling deeper infiltration into compromised networks. Recent attacks have been observed targeting the telecommunications, finance, and retail sectors across South Korea, Hong Kong, Myanmar, Malaysia, and Egypt.
item.dc:creator: Fernando Mercês
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Incomplete NVIDIA Patch to CVE-2024-0132 Exposes AI Infrastructure and Data to Critical Risks
item.description: A previously disclosed vulnerability in NVIDIA Container Toolkit has an incomplete patch, which, if exploited, could put a wide range of AI infrastructure and sensitive data at risk.
item.dc:creator: Abdelrahman Esmail
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Trend Vision One™ Now Supports Azure vTAP
item.description:
Effective April 2025, Microsoft is launching their Azure vTAP and integrating it with Trend Vision One Network Detection and Response solution.
This integration allows organizations to gain deep visibility into cloud network traffic without compromising performance. It ensures real-time detection, faster incident response, and an enhanced security posture while reducing operational complexity.
item.dc:creator: Janet Yao
Sara Atie
item.category: Trend Micro Research : APT & Targeted Attacks
Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: CTEM + CREM: Aligning Your Cybersecurity Strategy
item.description: Organizations looking to implement CTEM don’t have to start from scratch. CREM can help you get there faster, with actionable insights, automated workflows, and continuous risk reduction.
item.dc:creator: Alifiya Sadikali
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: GTC 2025: AI, Security & The New Blueprint
item.description: From quantum leaps to AI factories, GTC 2025 proved one thing: the future runs on secure foundations.
item.dc:creator: Shannon Murphy
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Capacity is Critical in Riskier Threat Landscape
item.description: International cooperation, reporting, and capacity building are critical to enhance cybersecurity defenses. Effective governance in an increasingly risky landscape requires visibility as well as coordinated vulnerability disclosure.
item.dc:creator: AI Team
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: The Espionage Toolkit of Earth Alux: A Closer Look at its Advanced Techniques
item.description: The cyberespionage techniques of Earth Alux, a China-linked APT group, are putting critical industries at risk. The attacks, aimed at the APAC and Latin American regions, leverage powerful tools and techniques to remain hidden while stealing sensitive data.
item.dc:creator: Lenart Bermejo
Ted Lee
Theo Chen
item.category: Trend Micro Research : APT & Targeted Attacks
Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: A Deep Dive into Water Gamayun’s Arsenal and Infrastructure
item.description: Trend Research discusses the delivery methods, custom payloads, and techniques used by Water Gamayun, the suspected Russian threat actor abusing a zero-day vulnerability in the Microsoft Management Console framework (CVE-2025-26633) to execute malicious code on infected machines.
item.dc:creator: Aliakbar Zahravi
Ahmed Mohamed Ibrahim
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Trend Cybertron: Full Platform or Open-Source?
item.description: Previously exclusive to Trend Vision One customers, select Trend Cybertron models, datasets and agents are now available via open-source. Build advanced security solutions and join us in developing the next generation of AI security technology.
item.dc:creator: Dave McDuff
item.category: Trend Micro Research : TM Vision One Platform
Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Trend Micro & IBM Team Up To Boost Mainframe Security
item.description: Trend Micro Deep Security adds security for mainframe enterprise integration
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: CVE-2025-26633: How Water Gamayun Weaponizes MUIPath using MSC EvilTwin
item.description: Trend Research identified Russian threat actor Water Gamayun exploiting CVE-2025-26633, a zero-day vulnerability in the Microsoft Management Console that attackers exploit to execute malicious code and exfiltrate data.
item.dc:creator: Aliakbar Zahravi
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Albabat Ransomware Group Potentially Expands Targets to Multiple OS, Uses GitHub to Streamline Operations
item.description: Trend Research encounters new versions of the Albabat ransomware, which appears to target Windows, Linux, and macOS devices. We also reveal the group’s use of GitHub to streamline their ransomware operation.
item.dc:creator: Nathaniel Morales
Sarah Pearl Camiling
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: ZDI-CAN-25373: Windows Shortcut Exploit Abused as Zero-Day in Widespread APT Campaigns
item.description: Trend Zero Day Initiative™ (ZDI) uncovered both state-sponsored and cybercriminal groups extensively exploiting ZDI-CAN-25373 (aka ZDI-25-148), a Windows .lnk file vulnerability that enables hidden command execution.
item.dc:creator: Peter Girnus
Aliakbar Zahravi
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: SocGholish’s Intrusion Techniques Facilitate Distribution of RansomHub Ransomware
item.description: Trend Research analyzed SocGholish’s MaaS framework and its role in deploying RansomHub ransomware through compromised websites, using highly obfuscated JavaScript loaders to evade detection and execute various malicious tasks.
item.dc:creator: Adam O'Connor
Ian Kenefick
Jack Walsh
Lucas Silva
Laura Medina
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: AI-Assisted Fake GitHub Repositories Fuel SmartLoader and LummaStealer Distribution
item.description: In this blog entry, we uncovered a campaign that uses fake GitHub repositories to distribute SmartLoader, which is then used to deliver Lumma Stealer and other malicious payloads. The campaign leverages GitHub’s trusted reputation to evade detection, using AI-generated content to make fake repositories appear legitimate.
item.dc:creator: Cj Arsley Mateo
Jacob Santos
Darrel Tristan Virtusio
Junestherry Dela Cruz
Paul John Bardon
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: From Event to Insight: Unpacking a B2B Business Email Compromise (BEC) Scenario
item.description: Trend Micro™ Managed XDR assisted in an investigation of a B2B BEC attack that unveiled an entangled mesh weaved by the threat actor with the help of a compromised server, ensnaring three business partners in a scheme that spanned for days. This article features investigation insights, a proposed incident timeline, and recommended security practices.
item.dc:creator: Jay Yaneza
Chrystian Bisi
Hitomi Kimura
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Exploiting DeepSeek-R1: Breaking Down Chain of Thought Security
item.description: This entry explores how the Chain of Thought reasoning in the DeepSeek-R1 AI model can be susceptible to prompt attacks, insecure output generation, and sensitive data theft.
item.dc:creator: Trent Holmes
Willem Gooderham
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Black Basta and Cactus Ransomware Groups Add BackConnect Malware to Their Arsenal
item.description: In this blog entry, we discuss how the Black Basta and Cactus ransomware groups utilized the BackConnect malware to maintain persistent control and exfiltrate sensitive data from compromised machines.

Stephen Carbery
Jovit Samaniego
Adam O'Connor
Gabriel Cardoso
Lucas Silva
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Updated Shadowpad Malware Leads to Ransomware Deployment
item.description: In this blog entry, we discuss how Shadowpad is being used to deploy a new undetected ransomware family. Attackers deploy the malware by exploiting weak passwords and bypassing multi-factor authentication.
item.dc:creator: Daniel Lunghi
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Earth Preta Mixes Legitimate and Malicious Components to Sidestep Detection
item.description: Our Threat Hunting team discusses Earth Preta’s latest technique, in which the APT group leverages MAVInject and Setup Factory to deploy payloads, and maintain control over compromised systems.
item.dc:creator: Nathaniel Morales
Nick Dai

item.description: This blog post details our analysis of an SEO manipulation campaign targeting Asia. We also share recommendations that can help enterprises proactively secure their environment.

item.title: CVE-2025-0411: Ukrainian Organizations Targeted in Zero-Day Campaign and Homoglyph Attacks
item.description: The Trend ZDI team offers an analysis on how CVE-2025-0411, a zero-day vulnerability in 7-Zip, was actively exploited to target Ukrainian organizations in a SmokeLoader campaign involving homoglyph attacks.

item.title: Native Sensors vs. Integrations for XDR Platforms?
item.description: Native sensors vs. integrations in XDR: Native sensors offer faster deployment, real-time detection, and deeper visibility, while integrations may add complexity and delays. Learn how to optimize your XDR strategy for improved security.

item.description: XDR is reshaping cybersecurity by unifying and enhancing SIEM and SOAR capabilities into a single platform. It addresses alert fatigue, improves incident correlation, simplifies operations, and enhances efficiency for SOC teams.

item.description: Network Detection and Response (NDR) is no longer a 'nice-to-have'—it’s essential. NDR complements EDR, accelerates incident response, and enhances visibility, making it a critical tool for modern cybersecurity strategies and service providers.

item.description: This blog entry provides an overview of CVE-2024-49112 and CVE-2024-49113 and includes information that organizations need to know to stay protected against potential exploitation.

item.title: AI Pulse: Top AI Trends from 2024 - A Look Back

item.title: Python-Based NodeStealer Version Targets Facebook Ads Manager
item.description: In this blog entry, Trend Micro’s Managed XDR team discusses their investigation into how the latest variant of NodeStealer is delivered through spear-phishing attacks, potentially leading to malware execution, data theft, and the exfiltration of sensitive information via Telegram.

item.title: FedRAMP ATO Boosts Zero Trust for Federal Agencies
item.description: Trend Vision One™ for Government has obtained a FedRAMP Authorization to Operate (ATO). This milestone enables Federal government customers to leverage Trend’s platform to rapidly stop adversaries and control their cybersecurity risk posture.

item.title: Link Trap: GenAI Prompt Injection Attack
item.description: Prompt injection exploits vulnerabilities in generative AI to manipulate its behavior, even without extensive permissions. This attack can expose sensitive data, making awareness and preventive measures essential. Learn how it works and how to stay protected.

item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Earth Koshchei Coopts Red Team Tools in Complex RDP Attacks
item.description: APT group Earth Koshchei, suspected to be sponsored by the SVR, executed a large-scale rogue RDP campaign using spear-phishing emails, red team tools, and sophisticated anonymization techniques to target high-profile sectors.

item.title: MITRE ATT&CK 2024 Results for Enterprise Security
item.description: Enterprise 2024 will incorporate multiple, smaller emulations for a more nuanced and targeted evaluation of defensive capabilities. We’re excited to offer two distinct adversary focus areas: Ransomware targeting Windows and Linux, and the Democratic People's Republic of Korea's targeting macOS.

item.title: MOONSHINE Exploit Kit and DarkNimbus Backdoor Enabling Earth Minotaur’s Multi-Platform Attacks

Daniel Lunghi
item.category: Trend Micro Research : APT & Targeted Attacks
Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: The Road to Agentic AI: Exposed Foundations
item.description: Our research into Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) systems uncovered at least 80 unprotected servers. We highlight this problem, which can lead to potential data loss and unauthorized access.
item.dc:creator: Morton Swimmer
Philippe Lin
Vincenzo Ciancaglini
Marco Balduzzi
Stephen Hilt
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Gafgyt Malware Broadens Its Scope in Recent Attacks
item.description: Our researchers identified threat actors exploiting misconfigured Docker servers to spread the Gafgyt malware. This threat traditionally targets IoT devices; this new tactic signals a change in its behavior.
item.dc:creator: Sunil Bharti
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: World Tour Survey: IT Operations’ Hands-on Defense
item.description: Trend surveyed 750 cybersecurity professionals in 49 countries to learn more about the state of cybersecurity, from job pressures to the need for more advanced tools. Explore what IT operations teams had to say.
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: AI Configuration Best Practices to address AI Security Risks
item.description: AI usage is on the rise as many companies are adopting AI for productivity gains and creation of new business opportunities which provide value to their customers.
item.dc:creator: Joy Ngaruro
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: AI Pulse: The Good from AI and the Promise of Agentic
item.description: The perils of AI get a lot of airtime, but what are the upsides? This issue of AI Pulse looks at some of the good AI can bring, from strengthening cybersecurity to driving health breakthroughs—and how the coming wave of agentic AI is going to take those possibilities to a whole new level.
item.dc:creator: AI Team
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Guess Who’s Back - The Return of ANEL in the Recent Earth Kasha Spear-phishing Campaign in 2024
item.description: Trend Micro has identified a spear-phishing campaign active in Japan since June 2024. Evidence about the malware used by this campaign suggests this was part of a new operation by Earth Kasha.
item.dc:creator: Hara Hiroaki
item.category: Trend Micro Research : APT & Targeted Attacks
Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Embracing a Risk-Based Cybersecurity Approach With ASRM
item.description: Explore how a risk-based cybersecurity approach is critical to proactively stopping dynamic, ever-evolving threats
item.dc:creator: Juan Pablo Castro
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Game of Emperor: Unveiling Long Term Earth Estries Cyber Intrusions
item.description: Since 2023, APT group Earth Estries has aggressively targeted key industries globally with sophisticated techniques and new backdoors, like GHOSTSPIDER and MASOL RAT, for prolonged espionage operations.
item.dc:creator: Leon M Chang
Theo Chen
Lenart Bermejo
Ted Lee
item.category: Trend Micro Research : APT & Targeted Attacks

item.title: Spot the Difference: Earth Kasha's New LODEINFO Campaign And The Correlation Analysis With The APT10 Umbrella
item.description: LODEINFO is a malware used in attacks targeting mainly Japan since 2019. Trend Micro has been tracking the group as Earth Kasha. We have identified a new campaign connected to this group with significant updates to their strategy, tactics, and arsenals.
item.category: Trend Micro Research : APT & Targeted Attacks
Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Inside Water Barghest’s Rapid Exploit-to-Market Strategy for IoT Devices
item.description: In this blog entry, we discuss Water Barghest's exploitation of IoT devices, transforming them into profitable assets through advanced automation and monetization techniques.
item.dc:creator: Feike Hacquebord
Fernando Mercês
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: 5 AI Security Takeaways featuring Forrester
item.description: Highlights from the recent discussion between Trend Micro’s David Roth, CRO Enterprise America, and guest speaker Jeff Pollard, VP, Principal Analyst, Forrester about AI hype versus reality and how to secure AI in the workplace.

item.title: Trend Micro and Japanese Partners Reveal Hidden Connections Among SEO Malware Operations
item.description: Trend Micro researchers, in collaboration with Japanese authorities, analyzed links between SEO malware families used in SEO poisoning attacks that lead users to fake shopping sites.
item.dc:creator: Makoto Shimamura
Shingo Matsugaya
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Breaking Down Earth Estries' Persistent TTPs in Prolonged Cyber Operations
item.description: Discover how Earth Estries employs a diverse set of tactics, techniques, and tools, including malware such as Zingdoor and Snappybee, for its campaigns.
item.dc:creator: Ted Lee
Leon M Chang
Lenart Bermejo
item.category: Trend Micro Research : APT & Targeted Attacks
Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: SOC Around the Clock: World Tour Survey Findings
item.description: Trend surveyed 750 cybersecurity professionals in 49 countries to learn more about the state of cybersecurity, from job pressures to the need for more advanced tools. Explore what SOC teams had to say.
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: AI Pulse: Election Deepfakes, Disasters, Scams & more
item.description: In the final weeks before November’s U.S. election, cybersecurity experts were calling October 2024 the “month of mischief”—a magnet for bad actors looking to disrupt the democratic process through AI-generated misinformation. This issue of AI Pulse looks at what can be done about deepfakes and other AI scams, and why defense-in-depth is the only way to go.
item.dc:creator: AI Team
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Attacker Abuses Victim Resources to Reap Rewards from Titan Network
item.description: In this blog entry, we discuss how an attacker took advantage of the Atlassian Confluence vulnerability CVE-2023-22527 to connect servers to the Titan Network for cryptomining purposes.
item.dc:creator: Ranga Duraisamy
Sunil Bharti
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Understanding the Initial Stages of Web Shell and VPN Threats: An MXDR Analysis
item.description: While cyberattacks that employ web shells and VPN compromise are not particularly novel, they are still prevalent. The recent incidents that Trend Micro MXDR analyzed highlight the importance of behavioral analysis and anomaly detection in security measures.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Maglaque
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Unmasking Prometei: A Deep Dive Into Our MXDR Findings
item.description: How does Prometei insidiously operate in a compromised system? This Managed Extended Detection and Response investigation conducted with the help of Trend Vision One provides a comprehensive analysis of the inner workings of this botnet so users can stop the threat in its tracks before it inflicts damage to the system.
item.dc:creator: Buddy Tancio
Bren Matthew Ebriega
Mohamed Fahmy
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Using gRPC and HTTP/2 for Cryptominer Deployment: An Unconventional Approach
item.description: In this blog entry, we discuss how malicious actors are exploiting Docker remote API servers via gRPC/h2c to deploy the cryptominer SRBMiner to facilitate their mining of XRP on Docker hosts.
item.dc:creator: Abdelrahman Esmail
Sunil Bharti
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Attackers Target Exposed Docker Remote API Servers With perfctl Malware
item.description: We observed an unknown threat actor abusing exposed Docker remote API servers to deploy the perfctl malware.
item.dc:creator: Sunil Bharti
Ranga Duraisamy
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Gartner 2024 CNAPP Market Guide Insights for Leaders
item.description: As businesses increasingly pivot to cloud-native applications, the landscape of cybersecurity becomes ever more challenging.
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: How to Mitigate the Impact of Rogue AI Risks
item.description: This is the latest blog in an ongoing series on Rogue AI. Keep following for more technical guidance, case studies, and insights.
item.dc:creator: AI Team
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Fake LockBit, Real Damage: Ransomware Samples Abuse Amazon S3 to Steal Data
item.description: This article uncovers a Golang ransomware abusing Amazon S3 for data theft, and masking as LockBit to further pressure victims. The discovery of hard-coded AWS credentials in these samples led to AWS account suspensions.
item.dc:creator: Jaromir Horejsi
Nitesh Surana
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports
